title: Tunable topological edge modes in Su-Schrieffer-Heeger arrays
authors:
G. J. Chaplain, A. S. Gliozzi, B. Davies, D. Urban, E. Descrovi, F.
  Bosia, R. V. Craster
abstract:
A potential weakness of topological waveguides is that they act on a fixed
narrow band of frequencies. However, by 3D printing samples from a
photo-responsive polymer, we can obtain a device whose operating frequency can
be fine-tuned dynamically using laser excitation. This greatly enhances
existing static tunability strategies, typically based on modifying the
geometry. We use a version of the classical Su-Schrieffer-Heeger model to
demonstrate our approach.
